intro: Benzoin aestivale, commonly known as summer benzoin, is a perennial plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, glandular leaves. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the summer months. Its roots and leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shady areas.
